DOC.brief_summary: According National Institute Mental Health , depressive disorder afflict six million U.S. men annually . Most case moderate severe depression treat antidepressant , include monoamine oxidase inhibitor , tricyclic antidepressant , , recently , selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor ( SSRIs ) antidepressants modest serotonin norepinephrine reuptake inhibition unknown mechanism-of-action . Over past two year , prescribe data show steady increase antidepressant dispense rate ( especially include serotonin reuptake inhibitor ) adult . SSRIs known effect ejaculatory function therapeutically use treatment premature ( rapid ) ejaculation . However , study evaluate potential impact antidepressant medication male fertility , study publish respect impact new antidepressant , SSRIs , male fertility . In high-volume male infertility practice New York Hospital-Cornell Medical Center , several patient present clear temporal association SSRI use impairment sperm motility and/or sperm transport ( emission ) . These men show improvement sperm count motility discontinuation antidepressant medication . We propose crossover pilot study normal healthy male ascertain possible effect SSRIs semen parameter . After initial screen semen analysis , subject take SSRI paroxetine five week . Serial semen analysis obtain medication one month discontinuation medication . Comparisons semen parameter medication use evaluate frequency significance semen analysis change SSRI treatment .
DOC.criteria: Normal , healthy male volunteer , age 1865 Must able swallow pill Known sexual dysfunction Tobacco use Prescription medication History psychiatric disorder Previous chemotherapy radiation treatment History seizure disorder Alcohol use great 2 ounce daily Illicit drug use Azoospermia screen semen analysis Varicocele Currently attempt achieve pregnancy
